body.p:
Cincinnati April 11" 1864
E. L. VanWinkle
Secretary of State of Kentucky
Dear Sir
The Commission issued to me was duly received this morning. I beg leave herewith to transmit the necessary fee and duplicate of affidavit to which I have sworn ho With many thanks I remain

Your Obedient Servant
Lyman Harding Jr.

(Duplicate of Affidavit)
State of Ohio>
Hamilton County } SS.
Cincinnati April 11"1864

Personally appeared before the undersigned authority the within named Lyman Harding Jr. and made oath that he would faithfully discharge all the duties appertaining to the office of Commissioner of Deeds in Ohio for Kentucky.
Sworing to and subscribed before me on the day and year above written

J. C. Thomas
Notary Public Ham. Co, Ohio
I hereby certify that the above is a true duplicate of the affidavit endorsed upon the back of the Commission to Lyman Harding Jr. and sworn to before me by him.

Ohio
Oath of
L. Harding Jr
Comr of Deeds
filed
12th Apl/64
